page.title: 05SPECIALISED EQUIPMENT (b)
page.content: A compact, fully equipped{Oncology {Unit}provides all necessary facilities for the comprehensive treatment of malignant disease. Patients are referred by G.Ps. and after specialist examination are treated by the radio- therapist who uses a computer planner to prescribe suitable radiation. Those requiring smaller 'doses' of radiation are admitted to the machine which discharges 75-250 kilo volts, while the remainder are treated on the{ {Linear Accelerator.} The treatment is quick and painless. Some patients do experience discomfort from the awkward positions sometimes necessary for accurate treatment. For face cancer a transparent mould of the face is made to avoid movement during treatment. Patients are treated in a closed room while the radiotherapist operates from outside using closed circuit T.V.
